info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 11 at 2:11PM CDT until May 11 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS NOW IN EFFECT LATE MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND WELL ABOVE AVERAGE TEMPERATURES FOR MUCH OF CENTRAL NEBRASKA...
The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds, low humidity, and well above normal temperatures, which is in effect from Monday morning through Monday evening.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains.
* TIMING...For the Red Flag Warning, continues through 9 PM CDT Sunday and for the Fire Weather Watch, valid from 11 AM CDT through 9 PM CDT Monday.
* WINDS...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...In the middle to upper teens.
* TEMPERATURES...Upper 80s.
* LIGHTNING...None expected.
* IMPACTS...Any fires which may develop, will have a high probability to spread rapidly and be difficult to control.
info.instruction:
A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND WELL ABOVE AVERAGE TEMPERATURES FOR ALL OF WESTERN AND NORTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA
